intro: Columnea grata, commonly known as the flame flower, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Columnea grata thrives in bright, indirect light and requires high humidity to flourish.
